page.title: 01Area around Gunwen Lowertown
page.content: This area of land stretches from the Luxulyan-Lockengate road northeast to the foot of Helman Tor. The western part consists of small farms, the farmhouses are old stone built dwellings, there is Trevelloin (very old) Penhale, Corgee, Higher middle & lower Gurtla and Gunwen. The land is mainly laid to grass, short or medium term ley for harvesting and grazing. The centre part of the area, which is around the hamlet of Gunwen is part grassland and part moorland, very wet with a lot of willow. The chapel at Gunwen was built on the site of the first Bible Christian chapel which was built on land given by the founder of that movement William O'Brien or Bryant, he was born at Gunwen Farm in 1778, and died at New York, 1868. The eastern part of this block is very wet with much willow and ruses,
